title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire - BBC News
summary: council applies for judicial review into horton hospital changes .
uncertainty over future of bakers in northamptonshire .

documents.title: that 's all from us
text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
we 'll be back on monday will all the latest news , weather , sport , and travel for northamptonshire .

if you want to follow northampton town 's trip to rochdale tomorrow afternoon then head to our twitter feed , and if you want to keep up with the snooker and charley hull in the ana inspiration head to the .
bbc sport website .
we 'll see you on monday from 08:00 .
have a great weekend .

documents.title: a dry night , with sunshine and showers tomorrow
text: tonight will be mostly dry across the bbc east region , with clear spells as temperatures drop to 7c ( 45f ) .
it 's a mixed bag of weather for saturday .
there 'll be sunny spells and the first of those april showers , some heavy with hail and thunder .
temperatures could reach 15c ( 59f ) .
weather has more details for where you live .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: kyren wilson beats ding junhui to set up china open semi
text: kettering 's kyren wilson is through to the semi-finals of the china open .
he beat last year 's snooker world championship runner-up ding junhui 5-1 .
the 25-year-old now faces world champion mark selby .
it 's wilson 's third ranking semi-final this season .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: rutland mp celebrates birthday
text: sir alan duncan tweets
with thanks to my private office , celebrating my birthday today .
# turning60
happy birthday to @ twitterid
happy birthday from oakham and rutland
many happy returns !
გილოცავთ დაბადების დღეს !
every follicle is numbered
happy delayed birthday , sir !
best wishes .
many happy returns , sir alan !
many happy returns sir !
happy 60th sir alan !
congratulations mr duncan , my finest wishes to your excellency and your family .
bt is not a celebration for me but it is worth cheering up .
many happy returns alan !
happy birthday sir @ twitterid
many happy returns !
excellency happy birthday and best wishes
you jeff banks and nigel farage all sharing a birthday
happy birhday , sir !
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: northamptonshire baker ceases trading after 'running out of cash '
text: the insolvency company working with oliver adams has told us that the business has ceased trading and is planning to enter voluntary liquidation next month .

ian cooke , from bri business recovery and insolvency , said a company voluntary arrangement ( cva ) with creditors that was agreed last year failed , because `` effectively [ oliver adams ] has run out of cash '' .
now the company 's 110 employees have been made redundant .
mr cooke said another company had been appointed to handle the liquidation and the asset would be sold .

mr cooke said having `` lived in northampton all my life '' he went to see `` about 100 of the employees '' to explain the situation , along with officials from the department for work and pensions and the jobcentre to help the company 's employees .
he said the employees were `` disappointed and angry '' , but said efforts to save the company `` just had n't worked '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: local news round-up : father raising money , special cinema screening and 'astro bowls '
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: when tackles go wrong # peoplescup
text: just how did those legs end up there ?
find out with our top 10 magic moments from last weekend 's fa people 's cup semi-finals .
for more fa people 's cup action , watch our semi-final highlights programme , .
available on the iplayer from 06:00 bst on saturday morning , 1 april , and on the red button at 13:50 bst and repeated throughout the weekend .

documents.title: northampton town centre car park to re-open after year and a half
text: the midsummer meadow car park in northampton is set to re-open this weekend .
it was closed in july 2015 as part of the widening of bedford road and the building work on the university of northampton 's new waterside campus .
the site has now been handed back to northampton borough council and will open again as a car park tomorrow .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: gp practice to shut as northampton healthcare contracts end
text: virgin care says its contract to run two gp practices in northampton will finish today .
the kings heath and lings brook practices have been run by the firm since october 2010 .
the bbc understands that while kings heath will remain open , lings brook ( will close .
in a statement , virgin care says it 's `` working with commissioners '' to make sure patient care is n't affected by the decision .
it 's not clear why the decision was made .
contracts like this are confidential , despite public money being involved , and quality of care does n't seem to be a factor - the last inspection rated lings brook `` good '' .
lings will close after today and its patients will be registered with other practices in the same building .
while we 're told kings heath will remain open and a new provider found , patients i 've spoken to say they do n't yet feel fully reassured .
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton saints forward james craig signs new deal along with academy players
text: northampton saints forward james craig has signed a new contract with the premiership club , with 10 academy players also agreeing extended deals .
second row craig , 28 , broke into the saints side in the 2011-12 campaign and has made 65 appearances .
`` he 's a talented player with a good rugby brain and has played well this season , '' said boss jim mallinder .
alex mitchell and james grayson , who helped england under-20s .
win the six nations , .
are among the others to sign .
the length of the deals have not been disclosed by the club .

half-backs mitchell and grayson have featured in the northampton first team this season along with fellow academy players james fish , alex moon and devante onojaife , who have also agreed contracts .
josh peters , tom emery , george furbank and props ehren painter and toby trinder are the others to commit their futures to the 2014 premiership champions .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: duncan : independence brought 'sense of community ' to rutland
text: rutland mp sir alan duncan has been speaking about the county 's 20th anniversary of independence from leicestershire .
`` there 's the sense of community that comes with it , '' mr duncan told bbc radio leicester .
`` when ted heath [ prime minister ] tried to get rid of it in 1972 the battle raged for 24 years until we got it [ independence ] back again . ''
the county will mark 20 years of independence tomorrow with a series of events at oakham castle .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: craig and youngsters sign saints deals
text: craig and youngsters sign saints deals

documents.title: weather : mostly bright and warm , though not as warm as yesterday
text: it will be another sunny and pleasantly warm afternoon across northamptonshire .
a few brief showers are likely for some of us , most likely around corby and the east with a high of a 16c ( 61f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: mp pleased 'vital service ' of corby urgent care centre continuing
text: yesterday it was announced the corby urgent care centre would stay open until at least the end of september , which corby 's mp tom pursglove described as a `` very positive step forward '' .
the contract between corby clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) and lakeside plus , which runs the centre , was due to expire today .
after a dispute about funding , lakeside plus said the centre would close , while the ccg vowed to keep it open .
but the two sides have now come to an agreement .
mr pusglove said the centre , which helps relieve pressure on kettering 's a & e , was `` such a vital service '' that represented `` best practice '' in the nhs .
he added : `` i 'm not concerned about who provides the service , but that the service is provided , because it is a model that works '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: uncertainty over future of bakers in northamptonshire
text: the northampton chronicle and echo is reporting that northampton bakery firm oliver adams has stopped production .
the paper says staff are currently in a meeting about the future of the business and branches are closed today across the county .
this sign was on the door on j lawrences on st giles street , which is owned by oliver adams
this sign was also in the window
however , when i went to the branch on mercers row it was open .
the staff there told me they did n't know what was happening with the company and did n't know if they were going to stay open .
they said when they arrived at the shop this morning they were able to open as normal .
we have attempted to contact oliver adams , but have been unable to .
we 'll bring you more when we get it .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: charley hull forced off at first major of the year after high winds
text: burton latimer 's charley hull got off to a pretty good start at the first women 's major of the year .
the 21-year-old was two under after seven holes at the ana inspiration when high winds stopped play .
gusts of 35mph were blowing when the players were taken off - after being allowed to finish their holes - at the event in california .
play will resume at 15:30 bst , with almost half the field yet to complete their first rounds at mission hills country club .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: no northampton bid for wales ' fly-half dan biggar , say ospreys
text: ospreys say they have received no contact from northampton about the potential transfer of wales ' fly-half dan biggar .
the 27-year-old is on a. national dual contract .
with ospreys and the welsh rugby union ( wru ) .
biggar 's deal expires at the end of next season and he has been linked with a move to the saints in 2018 .
`` northampton have not been in touch , '' ospreys managing director andrew millward told bbc wales sport .
`` being on an ndc [ national dual contract ] , i 'm not aware that northampton have gone to the wru .
`` i it [ the speculation ] up on twitter last week and apparently the signing was imminent .
the reality of the situation is dan 's not come to us and said he 's signed . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: council applies for judicial review into horton hospital changes
text: politicians in the south of the county have launched a legal challenge to plans to reduce services at a hospital used by thousands of local people .
they say the consultation process carried out into the proposals for horton general hospital in banbury was `` confusing and flawed '' .
the plans put together by the oxfordshire clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) include changes to maternity services , critical care and the use of hospital beds .
critics say the two-stage consultation the ccg carried out left people confused about what exactly was happening to their local hospital .
an application for a judicial review into the process has been launched by the district councils of south northamptonshire , cherwell and stratford-on-avon , as well as banbury town council .
the councils must now wait to hear if the case will proceed to the high court to be considered .
a decision on this is expected next month .
ccg spokesman richard mccrann said it had received the letter and `` will respond appropriately '' .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: leon lobjoit : prolific buckingham town striker bought by northampton town
text: league one side northampton town have signed striker leon lobjoit from non-league buckingham town on a two-year deal .
the 22-year-old has scored 62 goals in 36 games for the team who play in the 10th tier of english football .
he has spent time at mk dons and coventry city during his career and impressed on trial at the cobblers .
`` his attitude since coming in has been first class , '' boss justin edinburgh told .
the club 's website .
`` leon knows this is an important opportunity for him and he is determined to take it . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : mostly bright and just the outside chance of a shower
text: it will be a very mild start to the day , with any early brightness soon clouding over .
through the afternoon the cloud will break up to reveal some good spells of sunshine and just the outside chance of a shower .
it will be a little less warm than yesterday , but temperatures could still reach 17c ( 63f ) .
here 's my full forecast
you can find more details on the bbc weather website .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

it 's friday !
we are here bringing you the latest news , weather , sport and travel for northamptonshire .

text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .
we 'll be back tomorrow building up to northampton town 's trip to rochdale and uncertainty around two doctors ' surgeries in northampton .
any breaking news will appear through this evening and overnight , and we 'll see you tomorrow from 08:00 .

documents.title: weather : clear tonight and sunny spells and showers tomorrow
text: any evening showers should soon ease , to leave mostly dry conditions for the rest of the night with some clear spells .
it will be mild with a minimum temperature of 10c ( 50f ) .
tomorrow morning some showery rain will move eastwards .
by the afternoon it will turn drier and brighter , with sunny spells and a few light showers .
it 'll be a little less warm than today with a maximum temperature of about 17c ( 63f ) .
there are more details on bbc weather website .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: warth park extension : 'i am still very angry '
text: earlier we brought you news that east northamptonshire councillors granted planning permission for two giant warehouses near raunds and stanwick .
the extension to warth park will be used by a kitchen supply business .
there was plenty of local opposition to development and , as this email show , anger about the decision
i was at last night 's vote at the enc offices re warth park , and am still very angry .

i can not understand how this monstrosity can be imposed on the town of raunds and village of stanwick , when both councils ( raunds town council and stanwick parish council ) unanimously opposed it as indeed did the local populations of both .
indeed , a petition of 567 signatories against has been raised and presented to parliament by tom pursglove mp .
yet all this strength of feeling was completely ignored by 11 councillors , and what came across , was their main reason for this .
a continual theme running through their arguments , last night , was that if howden lost , subsequently appealed and won the appeal .
the council would have to pay howden 's appeal costs .
so these 11 , completely disregarded the moral obligation to support the will of their constituents , and voted in a cowardly and gutless way , bullied by the strength of howden 's financial might .

documents.title: james taylor and david sales join northamptonshire coaching staff
text: former england batsman james taylor has joined northamptonshire as a coaching consultant , while david sales has taken a part-time coaching role .
taylor ( 27 , retired with a. heart condition .
in april 2016 after seven england tests and 27 one-day games .
he has since worked with nottinghamshire and yorkshire 's academies in addition to media work .
former northants captain sales , who scored in excess of 22,000 runs in more than 20 years at the county ground before his retirement in 2014 , will work with the county 's batsmen .
`` david has been working part time with the batters since january , focusing on improving more of the technical aspects of their game , '' .
head coach david ripley said .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: nhs apprentice conference in kettering to find health service 's 'future workforce '
text: young people from nine secondary schools in the county have been at a conference in kettering today hearing about apprenticeships within the nhs .
nationally the health service has set a target of recruiting 100,000 apprentices by 2020 .
jo stewart , apprentice project manager for the nhs in northamptonshire , said the nhs was looking to `` develop our future workforce and deliver the key services '' .
dom anderson of trade union unison said it would be be working with trusts to make sure apprentices `` are n't just cheaper staff '' and were properly trained and mentored in their roles .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: local paper round-up : wellingborough prison plans , cafe plans and grants available
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mp opens pre-school playground in sherington
text: milton keynes north mp mark lancaster has been in ribbon-cutting mode today - visiting sherington pre-school in the new city to open a new playground .
fantastic to open sherington pre-school playground today .
congratulations to all those who helped make it happen

documents.title: weather : cloud clearing , then a dry , bright and warm day
text: it 'll be a brighter afternoon with some sunny spells developing , although there will perhaps be an occasional shower at times , too .
it 'll feel warm though , especially in any sunshine , with a high of 19c ( 66f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: fewer coaches on east midlands trains service
text: east midlands trains tweets
this affects a train running through leicester , loughborough and market harborough later .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: on this day : charles wicksteed born
text: charles wicksteed , the man behind wicksteed park in kettering , was born on this day 170 years ago .
wicksteed park was one of the first ever leisure parks in the uk , and last year its water chute was listed .
i wonder what he would make of the the new sway rider
happy 170th birthday to charles wicksteed , the creator of swings and slides as we know them today # heritage
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: taylor and sales join northants staff
text: taylor and sales join northants staff

documents.title: more than 20 dogs stolen from northampton kennels
text: nine adult dogs and 12 puppies were stolen from a kennels on the outskirts of northampton earlier this week .
it happened between 22:00 on tuesday and 09:30 on wednesday .
the thieves broke padlocks to access the kennels and are believed to have cut through fencing to get to the location .
the dogs taken included a female red cocker spaniel
a female cockerpoo
a female black and tan king charles cavalier
a female sable cocker spaniel with six chocolate and black sable puppies
and a female red cocker spaniel that was very heavily pregnant .
police are appealing for information .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: local paper owner johnston press announces £ 300m pre-tax loss
text: news publisher johnston press has announced a pre-tax loss for last year of £ 300m .
the group publishes several papers in the region , including the northampton chronicle and echo , the peterborough evening telegraph and the milton keynes citizen .
the valuation of its titles has been slashed in two tranches over the past year .
with its half-year results , it announced a write-down of £ 224m .
to that , it has added a reduction of £ 120m with its full-year figures .
the share price dropped 9 % after the annual results were published .
print advertising revenue was down from £ 149m to £ 123m in 2016 .
digital advertising remained below £ 19m .
there was an operating profit of £ 42m , but the major revaluations took the pre-tax statutory loss to £ 300m .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: corby urgent care centre to stay open
text: health bosses and the managers of the corby urgent care centre have said they have come to an agreement that means the health facility will stay open until at least the end of september 2017 .
the contact between corby clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) and lakeside plus , which runs the centre , was due to expire tomorrow .
after the dispute about funding , lakeside plus said the centre would close tomorrow , while the ccg vowed to keep it open .
the two parties have been been discussing the issue since last week , and have come to this agreement , although we do n't know any of the details .
a statement says that the ccg will be speaking to patients and residents to see what the future of the centre should be .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pirate ship replacement opens this weekend at wicksteed park
text: final tests are being carried out today on wicksteed park 's replacement ride for the popular pirate ship which was dismantled at the end of last season .
the new attraction is called `` sway rider '' and features 48 chairs being swung around to a height of 10m ( 32ft ) .
but the pirate ship , which was sold to a businessman live in kosovo , lives on with a painting of it adorning the new ride .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: knife found on man in northampton
text: yesterday evening northamptonshire police arrested a man in the street in northampton and found him carrying this knife , along with a quantity of drugs .
he was arrested and taken into custody .
earlier this week a knife was taken from a 12-year-old at a school in northampton , while this month the police have also held a series of knife amnesties around the county .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: warehouses given go-ahead despite local opposition
text: east northamptonshire councillors have granted planning permission for two giant warehouses near raunds and stanwick .
the extension to warth park should create about 350 jobs and see other posts transferred from northampton .
the warehouses will be used by the howdens kitchen supply business .
councillor philip stearn , who chaired last night 's meeting , said businesses in raunds would `` be better for [ the development ] '' and that warehouses would bring `` genuine jobs '' .
however , people from raunds and stanwick demonstrated outside the council offices in thrapston , and were angry at the result .
councillors voted 11-6 in favour of the development .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: thursday 's weather : warm with sunny spells
text: this could be the warmest day of the year so far .
it 'll be bright rather than sunny for most of the morning , with plenty of high cloud around , but the good news is that the sun will break through this afternoon .
there 'll be a top temperature of about 20c ( 68f ) , but it could be even warmer in some more favoured spots .
watch my full regional forecast here :
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

we are back with live updates for northamptonshire .

documents.title: farewell for today
text: our regular updates of news , travel , sport and weather have come to an end for today .
thanks for joining us .
however , any breaking stories will still appear here overnight .
have a pleasant evening and we 'll see you again at 08:00 .

BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : cloudy night , brighter tomorrow
text: this evening will stay rather cloudy with the odd spot of drizzle possible , but mainly dry .
a few showery outbreaks of rain later but another mild night .
winds light south or south-westerly .
lows of 9c ( 48f ) .
tomorrow will see some isolated showers at first , but it will become drier and brighter with sunny spells and feeling warm .
winds light to moderate south or south-westerly .
highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
for more , visit .
bbc weather .

documents.title: engineering firm ch2m pulls out of hs2 railway line deal
text: an engineering company has pulled out of part of the hs2 high-speed rail link contract .
the american firm ch2m now wo n't be going ahead with work on the `` second phase '' of the project , linking crewe to manchester and birmingham to leeds .
the contract signing was delayed as officials were reportedly investigating concerns from rival bidder mace over alleged conflicts of interest .
ch2m had already been awarded a separate contract on the first phase that will run between london and birmingham , through parts of buckinghamshire and northamptonshire .
it said it was `` fully committed '' to working on this phase .
ch2m blamed the exit on `` protracted delays and ongoing speculation '' .
a spokesman said : `` ch2m has demonstrated all appropriate measures taken throughout to ensure the integrity of the procurement process . ''

documents.title: mp asks for adult social care review
text: the northampton south mp has asked the prime minister to review the way adult social care works in northamptonshire .

speaking during prime minister 's questions , david mackintosh said he welcomed the additional money given by the government for social care , but added it was important to look at long-term solutions .
he invited teresa may to look at some of the cases he was aware of in his constituency and how well the system worked when the county council and the general hospital were involved .
mrs may said it was important to make sure that best practice was observed across the country .
she said the government wanted to find a sustainable long-term solution for social care , which will help local authorities learn from each other .
she added there will be a green paper later in the year with proposals to put the state funding system on a more secure footing .
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: tributes to coventry man killed in horror crash on a5
text: the family of a man killed in a double fatal collision on the a5 on sunday paid tribute to a man who will be 'missed dearly ' .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: man 's campaign for statue to suffragette relative receives donation
text: it looks as though a man 's efforts to create a permanent memorial to his well-known great grandmother have finally borne fruit .
alice hawkins helped to lead the campaign for votes for women in leicester and was jailed five times in the process .

her great grandson peter barratt , who lives in irthlingborough , northamptonshire , has spent four years trying to raise funds for a statue on leicester market square , on the site where ms hawkins made several speeches .
a donation of £ 62,400 to cover the project 's cost has now been offered by the developers that own the old shoe factory where ms hawkins worked .
`` it 's a great feeling , '' said mr barratt .
`` it 's been difficult along the way but now we 've had this breakthrough . ''
next year marks the centenary of women being given the vote in the uk and it 's hoped that the statue will be on display in time for the celebrations .
it 'll be the first named statue of a woman in leicester .
it 's important that - 100 years on - we do commemorate those valiant women . ''
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: corby lottery goes live
text: the first tickets have been sold in corby 's local lottery , which has been set up to raise money for voluntary and community groups in the borough .
the online system is now live and the first draw will take place a month from today .
a previous launch of the sales website was aborted earlier this month because the borough council had n't been given the licence to run it at that stage .
the jackpot in the borough council 's game will be £ 25,000 and tickets cost £ 1 .
`` when you go online and buy a ticket , you can nominate which cause you want 50 % of each pound to go to , '' said the council 's director of corporate services , adrian sibley .
a further 10 % of the ticket price will be distributed to other good causes and 20 % will be added to the prize fund .
an external operator will take 16 % , and the rest will be paid in vat .
organisers say the return for good causes compares well with the 28 % from the national lottery .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: campaign against kitchen firm warehouses
text: a decision is due tonight on controversial plans for two large warehouses in raunds .
the development will extend the existing warth park industrial estate on the edge of the town .
campaigners say the round-the-clock operation for the kitchen suppliers , howdens , will cause too much disturbance and extra traffic .
there 's also concern about the size of the buildings and the loss of open space .
`` the valley is being built up 20 metres , and the building sited on top of this , '' said june longhurst , who has a smallholding close to the development .
`` it 's just too big to even be contemplated in a small rural area like this . ''
the campaigners intend to be at tonight 's planning meeting .
there is so much feeling and so much angst .
it 's going to be urban sprawl . ''
the developers , roxhill , have declined to comment at this stage .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: rise in animal cruelty in northamptonshire
text: new figures show there 's been a rise of almost 5 % in the number of reported cases of animal cruelty in northamptonshire .
the rspca received nearly 2,000 complaints from the county last year , which equates to about five cases every day .
the northamptonshire figure is higher than the regional and national averages .
rspca inspectors said many cases involved people who could n't afford vet bills when their animals became ill .
having a pet is a luxury .
if you want these luxuries , you have to be able to afford them . ''
author: Martin Heath
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: brexit : politicians on both sides say 'get on with it '
text: with the letter triggering article 50 due to be handed to the european council within hours , northamptonshire 's politicians are hoping the brexit process will get under way quickly .

conservative peter bone , the wellingborough mp who 's a leading campaigner for the uk 's departure from the union , told us : `` the vast majority of people want to get on with the process and get the best deal for us and the european union . ''
glenis willmott is one of northamptonshire 's meps and agreed rapid progress was essential .
`` we 've made the decision and we 've got to get on with it , '' said ms willmott , labour , who backed remain in last year 's referendum .
`` we need the best deal for everybody , not just those at the top who 've done very well over the last few years . ''
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: mobbs memorial match : and the band played on
text: following the march to the ground , the band of the parachute regiment played the national anthem .
in the end bedford beat the army 55-26 .
the band proved so popular supporters asked for it to be there at every game .
the memorial match is an annual event and next year it will be held at northampton saints ' franklin 's gardens .
what a way to start the evening !
can we have them at every home game please ?
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: band marches for mobbs
text: the bedford blues took on the british army last night at the annual mobbs memorial game at goldington road .
first played in 1921 , the game honours lt col edgar mobbs who was killed 100 years ago in world war one .
he was born in northampton , educated in bedford and represented england at rugby .
before last night 's match the band of the parachute regiment marched from the bedford cenotaph on the embankment , where a wreath laying ceremony was performed , to the ground .
next year the match will be held at northampton saints ' stadium .
here they are on their way , with video taken by chris brodie
author: Alex Pope
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leave voters in northamptonshire 'optimistic '
text: as the formal process of leaving the eu begins , we 've been finding out how people across northamptonshire are feeling about brexit .
tim godfrey , who 's from northampton and works in the health service , told us he 'd voted to leave the union and believes `` positivity is the way forward '' .
`` the uk may make a real success out of being the uk '' , he says .
`` we can get good free trade agreements with europe and the rest of the world . ''
the official notice triggering article 50 will be delivered to donald tusk , the european council president , at lunchtime .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: brexit : corby business owner concerned about trade
text: as theresa may signs the letter that will formally begin the uk 's departure from the european union , we 've been finding out how people across northamptonshire are feeling about brexit .
dorean jarvis runs a children 's clothes shop in corby and said the most important part for her is a trade deal .
`` i 'm worried about the value of the pound because i source a lot of my products from eu countries , '' she said .

`` what about the tariffs that will be imposed because [ at the moment ] we 've got free trade and i 'm very worried that a lot of my customers are going to lose the products , because if the tariffs are imposed it 's going to make business very difficult . ''
the official notice , triggering article 50 , will be delivered to european council president donald tusk this lunchtime .

documents.title: weather : mild and cloudy with some sunny spells
text: today will be mostly dry and bright with variable amounts of cloud , allowing some sunny spells at times - especially during the afternoon .
there 's a chance of rain this morning in places and it 'll feel pleasantly warm by afternoon , with south-westerly winds freshening things later .
maximum temperature 16c ( 61f ) .
here 's my latest forecast
for more , head to bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to today 's live updates for northamptonshire
text: good morning and welcome to another day of live updates from northamptonshire .
we 'll be here from now until 18:00 bringing you the very latest news , sport , weather and travel .
today , as britain formally serves notice on brussels that it 's leaving the european union , we 'll be keeping an eye on the local reaction .
but first a full regional weather forecast
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

text: live updates for northamptonshire have now finished .

we 'll see you then .

documents.title: weather : a cloudy night but brighter tomorrow
text: it will turn cloudy with some patchy rain across the bbc east region , but it 'll be mainly dry this evening and overnight and much milder than last night with lows of 9c ( 48f ) in light south-westerly winds .
tomorrow will start mild with one or two showers first thing .
it will be generally dry and bright later with sunny spells .
winds will be light to moderate south-westerly .
highs of 16c ( 60f ) .
for a full forecast visit bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: thousands of ladders withdrawn from sale over safety fears
text: derbyshire county council is warning diy enthusiasts , tradesmen and gardeners to check telescopic ladders thoroughly and use them with care .
an investigation led to more than 32,000 dangerous sets being withdrawn from sale after trading standards inquired into the safety of telescopic ladders .
the investigation was led by derby city council , leicestershire county council and northamptonshire county council alongside the government .
many of the ladders were easily damaged during testing , showing they were not robust enough for general wear and tear .
in the worst case , a ladder snapped in half beneath the test load − despite claiming to comply with the safety standard , the county council said .
this is bad enough under any circumstances , but when it is placing people in danger , it simply is n't acceptable .
author: Khia Lewis-Todd
BBC Local Live

documents.title: respite care provider to re-allow admissions after 'positive discussion '
text: within the last few minutes , the operator of four speialist care homes in northamptonshire has said they will re-start admissions .
it follows a suspension of admissions which was affecting respite patients .

a statement from the operator said : `` shaw healthcare has been in positive discussions with northamptonshire county council and its health partners and we expect that admissions will be reinstated as soon as possible . ''
it provides respite care to frail and vulnerable people including those discharged from hospital .
their four specialist centres in northamptonshire are in northampton , rushden , daventry and corby .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: closer working between fire and police 'going back to the future ' says pcc
text: the close working relationship between northamptonshire 's police and fire services is now being looked at as a national way forward .
in january , a law was passed allowing police and crime commissioners ( pccs ) to take responsibility for fire and budgets as well .
northamptonshire says it was the first place in the country to suggest doing this .
both services here already share some buildings , a training facility and vehicle maintenance .
northamptonshire 's pcc , stephen mold , says it saves money , and is not a new idea
in far cotton they used to have a police and fire station .
it 's not a new idea , it 's almost going back to the future . ''
author: Tom Percival
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: police officer take knife from 12-year-old school pupil
text: a knife has been confiscated from a 12-year-old at a school in northampton .
a psco tweeted that the pupil was now being `` dealt with by officers '' .
earlier this month northamptonshire police held a series of knife amnesties around the county .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man and woman named after fatal crash on a5 on sunday
text: police have named the two people who died following a collision on the a5 near towcester on sunday .
a car and motorcycle crashed outside jacks hill cafe at about 12:30 .
the driver of the car was 60-year-old shirley mcclements , from nether heyford , near towcester .
the motorcyclist has been identified as 51-year-old steven atkins from coventry .
his family said : `` steven was a skilled engineer and a lifetime motorcyclist .
he will be dearly missed by his partner , all his family and his many friends and colleagues . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: red nose day actually shoes and jacket interesting bidders
text: the shoes and jacket worn by bill nighy in the special love actually sequel red nose day actually , filmed for comic relief , are being auctioned for the charity .
the shoes , designed by northampton firm jeffery west , were made in italy .
if you want to bid , you can via ebay , but bidding is currently at £ 1,550.00 with five days to go .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: slimmed-down cult band announce uk tour
text: the new trio version of northampton-based cult prog-rock band the enid have announced a short uk tour .
the band has slimmed down since robert john godfrey , who founded the band in 1974 , retired as an active member last year following his dementia diagnosis .
the five-date tour begins at cambridge 's portland arms on 21 june and ends at london 's bush hall on 29 june , promoting their new album resurgency .

new keyboard player zachary bullock said : `` the band 's capacity to reinvent itself over the decades is one of the reasons we are still going strong today , and we are really excited to show you our new sound and experience . ''

documents.title: memorial game taking place to honour 'rugby legend and war hero '
text: bedford rufc club take on the british army tonight in the annual mobbs memorial game at goldington road .
tonight 's match marks 100 years since edgar mobbs was killed in world war one .
first played in 1921 , the game honours lt col edgar mobbs dso , who was killed in the third battle of ypres in 1917 .
he was born in northampton , went to bedford modern , and went on to play for england .
bedford and northampton stage the fixture on alternate years .
kick-off tonight is at 19:45 and the band of the parachute regiment will march through the goldington road gates at 17:00 .
the march will pass the bedford cenotaph on the embankment where a wreath-laying ceremony will be performed between 16:00 and 16:30 .
honouring a real rugby legend & war hero tonight in the mobbs memorial match , plenty of tickets available at the gate , just £ 10 entry # mobbs

documents.title: local paper round-up : gp recruitment problems and kettering councillor tributes
text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : brighter and warmer this afternoon
text: it will become brighter and warmer this afternoon as sunny spells develop with a high of 15c ( 59f ) .
there are more details for where you are on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: man has neck slashed in northampton
text: a man was slashed in the neck as he stood outside the jade restaurant on northampton 's racecourse .
it happen at about 15:15 yesterday , and the 20-year-old victim suffered a cut to neck and was also punched in the face .
the offender was described as white , aged about 26 , 5ft 8in with short black hair .
he was wearing a yellow jacket .
police are appealing for witnesses .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: problems on london midland through milton keynes and northampton
text: due to a fault on a train between milton keynes & northampton services running through these stations may be cancelled , delayed or revised

documents.title: funding and other issues behind care centre admission ban
text: i 've been speaking to the nhs nene clinical commissioning group .
( ccg ) about the decision by shaw healthcare to suspend new admissions to four specialist care centres in northamptonshire .
shaw run the centres at turn furlong in northampton ( spinneyfields in rushden , longlands in daventry and thackley green in corby..
these centres provide respite care for elderly or frail people .

a statement from the northamptonshire county council yesterday said that shaw 's decision to suspend admissions was `` as a result of some recent concerns about wider health support services being provided to these centres '' .
a spokeswoman for nene ccg said the `` primary issue '' for shaw is funding and there are other `` multiple issues '' .
the issue affecting the ccg is apparently the long-standing requirement for patients to be registered with a gp in order to receive non-urgent treatment .
the council says they and health partners are `` actively seeking a resolution to the situation '' .
shaw healthcare has declined to comment at this stage .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'north northamptonshire ' given £ 1m from government for house buidling
text: the government has announced that authorities in `` north northamptonshire '' are to receive £ 1.1m to `` speed up house building on large sites and deliver thousands of new homes '' .
the money is to be split across corby borough council , east northamptonshire council , kettering borough council , wellingborough borough council .
and northampton borough council .
housing and planning minister , gavin barwell said the money was `` giving councils the tools they need to tackle delays and get builders on site much faster '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: where could the new twenty20 competition be based ?
text: the are some obvious candidates for eight new teams for the cricket 's twenty20 tournament which is to start in 2020 .
test grounds such as old trafford in manchester , headingley in leeds , edgbaston in birmingham and trent bridge in nottingham will surely each have a team .
the question is what do you call them ?
calling them by their city names might alienate potential fans from other parts of their historic counties .
would northants fans go and see nottingham ?
but , with a proposed a players ' draft .

( where a pool of top players is divvied-up among the competing teams , regardless of which county they are signed to ) , it 's likely top northants performers like ben duckett ( might end up at any of the eight teams .
london will be likely to have two teams , with lords and the oval hosting games , and even talk of matches at the olym stadium .
so , if you 're counting , that 's six teams .
the final two - well one definitely in the south - but there are some big counties down there such as kent , sussex and hampshire - so who would host it ?
we do n't know .
finally there could be a team based at bristol - but then what about cardiff ?
it 's a test venue , a city , but would it have the fan base ?
would they even called the team wales ?
there are lots of unanswered questions , but tom harrison , the ecb 's boss , himself a former northamptonshire player , and pupil at oundle school , is determined to make the new competition work .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: could the new city-based t20 feature games at the county ground ?
text: more now on the proposed eight-team , city-based twenty20 tournament , which looks likely to begin in 2020 .

in the telegraph , their cricket correspondent , and former northampton chronicle and echo cricket reporter , nick hoult suggests northamptonshire might not miss out altogether on the new tournament .
ecb chief executive , and former northamptonshire player tom harrison , has said the new competition would feature eight new teams , rather than the current 18 counties .
it is most likely these teams will be based around cities and england test venues .

in the his piece for the telegraph , nick hoult suggests the proposals could include a team based at nottinghamshire 's trent bridge , which would `` have the capacity to play matches in leicester , derby and northampton as they battle with birmingham to be the dominant club of the midlands '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lift tower lit up for tourism campaign
text: a new tourism campaign .
began yesterday aiming to boost northamptonshire 's economy by £ 500m in the next five years .
the day culminated in the lighting up of the northampton lift tower , with the campaign 's slogan `` northamptonshire - britain 's best surprise '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket needs to 'start appealing to a younger audience '
text: england and wales cricket board chief tom harrison has said the new eight-team , city-based twenty20 tournament will make cricket `` relevant to a whole new audience and bring this very diverse , multicultural britain in to our stadiums in a way perhaps we have n't been successful in doing '' .
the former northamptonshire player told me : `` what we absolutely need to do , is start appealing to a younger audience . ''
author: Dan Roan
BBC Sports editor

documents.title: serious assault in brackley closes road
text: yesterday evening a serious assault closed manor road in brackley near the supermarket for almost two hours .
when we find out more details about what happened we 'll bring them to you

documents.title: city-based twenty20 tournament moves a step closer
text: a new eight-team , city-based twenty20 tournament could `` absolutely rival the indian premier league '' says england and wales cricket board chief tom harrison .
the competition , proposed to begin in 2020 , moved a step closer on monday as further details were revealed .
ecb chief executive harrison , a former northamptonshire player , said it was `` not a gamble '' for the 18 first-class counties .
`` what we are doing here is future-proofing county cricket , '' harrison told bbc sports editor dan roan .
`` i do n't think it 's so much a gamble , it 's about saying 'what do we want our business and our game to look like ? ' ''
it means that northamptonshire , last year 's t20 winners , and winners in 2013 , would not be involved in the country 's premier limited-overs competition .
however , the t20 blast competition would still continue , and the two competitions would not overlap .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: sunny spells followed by showers
text: another misty and murky start to the day .
it 'll brighten up later , with some sunny spells followed by showers .
feeling warm , with temperatures reaching 17c ( 62f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning .
we are back with live updates for northamptonshire .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , weather , sport and travel for the county .
we 've got some cricket news for you , first thing this morning .
but first up the weather forecast , if you can see it .

documents.title: tuesday will be warm , sunny and wet
text: it should remain dry tonight , with some mist and fog , and a patchy frost .
temperatures falling to 3c ( 37f ) .
the mist and fog will clear more quickly tomorrow than it did today .
we 'll then see some sunny spells but also some showers which could turn heavy and thundery .
top temperatures , in the sunshine , could reach 20c ( 68f ) .
click on bbc weather to find a more detailed forecast for where you live .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: respite care provider suspends admissions
text: admissions to four specialist care centres in northamptonshire have been suspended , according to the county council .
shaw healthcare provides respite care to frail and vulnerable people , including those discharged from hospital .
the centres affected are turn furlong in northampton , spinneyfields in rushden , longlands in daventry and thackley green in corby .
shaw healthcare is contracted to providing a range of services at the four centres under a 25-year contract signed in 2003 .
the county council says as the result of some recent concerns about wider health support services being provided to these centres , shaw healthcare took the decision to suspend new admissions .
it says it is `` regrettable '' and hopes the matter can be quickly resolved .
there are concerns the suspension could worsen so-called bed blocking at hospitals .
shaw healthcare has yet to comment .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northamptonshire village twinned with barcelona ?
text: it looks like finedon vicar and broadcaster richard coles is getting on board with today 's tourism campaign about northamptonshire being `` britain 's best surprise '' .
sadly , the east northamptonshire village of stoke doyle is not twinned with barcelona - the sign is .
a joke by villager martin stansfield .
that has remained intact for almost seven years .
east northamptonshire # worldclass
@ twitterid funny , i was in barcelona last month , but i never noticed any signs saying they were twinned with stoke doyle
ruddy tourists stealing them i expect .
evidently not a problem that stoke doyle is struggling with
super vigilant neighbourhood watch in stoke .
that would explain it .
that sign is begging to be pinched .
does barcelona know about this ?
they begged for it .
i 'm guessing that stoke doyle is a lovely place , but i 'm also guessing a size difference .
stoke doyle ( plus pilton and wadenhoe ) 244 ; barcelona 1,600,000 .
no comparison then
if i was held for ransom in 1970 's california .
and only one person could save me .
i 'd chose the uncompromising stoke doyle .
assuming he could be bothered to take the time out from his lucrative porno career .
stoke does what stoke wants .
and the ladies love his pony-tail .
or as the great linda smith said : `` my hometown is n't twinned with anywhere .
but it does have a suicide pact with dagenham . ''
takes about 30 seconds to drive through this place # rutlandtwinningweirdness
still not as good as hay on wye being twinned with timbuktu
you all laugh now but by 10pm that road will be teeming with glow sticks and jibbering all night rave monkeys .
come visit snowdonia soon .
dogs very welcome .
vip welcome awaits you both & hounds .
@ twitterid strange then , that northamptonshire voted overwhelmingly for brexit .
@ twitterid so sweet !
but ever so slightly different

text: elsewhere in northamptonshire :
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police seize knives , whip and a blue flashing light during search
text: what do you reckon they had planned with these objects ?
hmmm
several weapons , including knives and a whip , were found in a house search by police in kettering last night .
before that officers searched a car , which had failed to stop , and discovered items used for stealing fuel , burgling homes - and a blue flashing light for good measure .
two people were arrested .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: saints ' season 'annoying ' - lennie newman
text: i 'm the eternal optimist , but the defeat against leicester on saturday means that 's about it for saints ' top-four hopes .
it 's a tough run-in and i think it will go down to the final game against harlequins for sixth or seventh .
the story of saints ' season has been very up and down , with a lack of consistency and , quite honestly , putting their foot in their own mouth at times - it 's annoying .
author: Lennie Newman
Former Northampton Saints player and manager

documents.title: northampton saints ' boss jim mallinder 'realistic ' about play-off chances
text: northampton saints ' director of rugby jim mallinder says defeat by leicester leaves his side aiming at best for a top-six premiership finish .
the .
36-31 loss at franklin 's gardens .
left saints seventh in the table , six points off fourth with four games left .
it also meant a seventh straight defeat in all competitions against their east midlands rivals .
`` you never say never , but i think that 's what we 're aiming for , '' .
mallinder told bbc radio northampton .
northampton face a tough run-in with away fixtures at top two wasps and exeter , either side of a 'home ' meeting with third-placed saracens at stadium : mk .
the 2014 champions , who failed to reach this weekend 's champions cup quarter-finals , conclude their season with a home match against harlequins .
`` it 's going to be tough , but that 's the premiership , '' added mallinder .
author: Kris Holland
BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : bright sunshine this afternoon
text: after a misty start there will be plenty of brighter , warmer and occasionally sunny weather during the afternoon , with a high of 14c ( 57f ) .
there are more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: county residents 'do n't know what 's within three or four miles of them '
text: charles lister , property manager at boughton house , said the new tourism campaign was not just aimed at those outside the county , but also people in northamptonshire .
`` northamptonshire - britain 's best surprise '' is being launched today at the stately home .
mr lister said `` those that live here do n't know what 's within three or four miles of them '' .
he said there was `` so much to do '' in northamptonshire and boughton house was the ideal place to unveil the campaign .
he said the home of the duke of beccleuch was `` one of the many '' stately homes that formed part of the campaign and `` embodied '' the drive to bring more tourists in .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: saints 'realistic ' over top-four hopes
text: saints 'realistic ' over top-four hopes

documents.title: tourism campaign created by 'people who feel passionately about the county '
text: james lowther , owner of holdenby house and the man behind the new tourism campaign for northamptonshire , says it is the `` biggest and most focused '' tourist drive the county has had .
he said the impetus had previously `` come from local government '' , but this was a `` coalition with a whole lot of people '' , including the university of northampton and the royal and derngate .
mr lowther said people had `` given time for nothing because they feel passionately about the county '' .
in 2015 northamptonshire had 20 million tourist visits , generating 13,000 jobs and £ 1bn for the economy .
however , mr lowther pointed out that tourism in similarly-sized gloucestershire was worth £ 1.5bn a year , and the ambition was to `` get up to that level '' in the next five years .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: britain 's best surprise ?
text: a new tourism campaign being launched today aims to boost northamptonshire 's economy by £ 500m in the next five years .
an event at boughton house and a 3d projection on northampton 's lift tower tonight will mark the unveiling of `` northamptonshire - britain 's best surprise `` .
the man behind the campaign is the owner of holdenby house ( and former creative director of saatchi & saatchi , james lowther .
he said the campaign was `` very exciting and very inspiring '' .
advertising has already gone up on the escalators at euston station in london , featuring 24 historic houses in northamptonshire .
mr lowther said the county had plenty to offer with `` the best historic houses in the country , best churches , fantastic food and drink and amazing theatres '' .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: duckett scores half century for mcc in season opener
text: the county cricket season officially got under way yesterday , with champions middlesex taking on mcc in abu dhabi .
northamptonshire 's ben duckett ( made 69 off 88 balls in mcc 's 332 all out .
worcestershire batsman joe clarke top-scored with 89 .
middlesex closed 9 for 1 in reply .
play resumes today at 11:00 .
author: Alex Winter
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: force india score a double top 10 in australian grand prix
text: meanwhile , silverstone-based force india turned a lot of heads in melbourne with their brand new pink car .
their drivers justified the attention too , with two top ten finishes in the season opening f1 grand prix .
sergio perez finished seventh , after qualifying 10th , while his team-mate eastban ocon benefited from a retirement from mclaren 's fernando alonso to finish 10th .
force india were one of only four teams that had both cars finish the race , along with ferrari , mercedes and toro rosso .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: lewis hamilton believes he can beat sebastian vettel to world title
text: lewis hamilton says he is confident he can beat sebastian vettel to the world title this year , despite defeat at the australian grand prix .
stevenage 's hamilton , driving for brackley-based mercedes , finished second to the german in the f1 season opener in melbourne .
he lost the lead following pressure from the ferrari driver 's superior pace .
hamilton said : `` it is going to be a close race .
i truly believe we can beat them .
it 's great to see ferrari there .
`` it 's good we had this close battle .
i 'm looking forward to the next . ''
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer in Melbourne

documents.title: two dead in crash near towcester
text: two people have died in a crash in the south of the county .
it involved a car and a motorbike outside jacks hill cafe on the a5 near towcester .
the driver of the car and the motorcyclist both died at the scene .
it happened at about 12:30 yesterday .
police want to speak to any witnesses .
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: monday 's weather : warm in the sunshine once the low cloud lifts
text: there 's a cloudy , misty and murky start to the day for some of us , but the good news is , it 'll turn a little brighter later on this morning .

the low cloud will be quite quick to lift , particularly in the south of the region , but parts of north norfolk and suffolk could potentially remain cloudy for much of the day and with the on-shore , north-easterly breeze it 's going to struggle with the temperatures , with a maximum of 8c ( 46f ) there .
away from that , in the sunshine , we could get up to 16c ( 61f ) .

documents.title: anger over 'londonshire ' estate delays
